docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO -- Until last year, Tom Steyer was just another billionaire hedge fund manager intent on keeping a low profile. ''I haven't done that much so there hasn't been that much to talk about,'' Mr. Steyer, 54, said in an interview recently in the offices of his firm, Farallon Capital Management.

headline.main: Hedge Fund Chief Takes Major Role in Philanthropy

docs.abstract: Billionaire hedge fund manager Thomas Steyer founds nonprofit Center for the Next Generation with brother Jim; Center is aimed at influencing public policy, goal that has become common one among nation's top philanthropies; photos (M)

headline.main: When It's Time to Hit the Road

docs.abstract: A few trips for traveling caregivers.
docs.snippet: A few trips for traveling caregivers.

byline.original: By ALYSON MARTIN and NUSHIN RASHIDIAN

docs.lead_paragraph: Sometimes you travel because you want to, sometimes because you need to. Whatever the reason, planning a trip can be logistical nightmare for caregivers. But there are ways to smooth the journey, experts say.

headline.main: When It's Time to Hit the Road

byline.original: By ALYSON MARTIN and NUSHIN RASHIDIAN

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly one million more Americans went without health insurance in 2010. The distressing news is further evidence of the need for government safety net programs and the health care reforms.
